moves.1. e4: Kings Gambit, an interesting winning attack although White could have won more quickly.
moves.1... e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Bc4 Nf6 4. Nc3 Nc6: White decides to go for the attack.
moves.7... Ng4 8. Nd5 Bc5+: Not the best move, better was Ba5 because the Bishop can be driven back with tempo.
moves.9. d4 Bb6 10. Bxf4 d6 11. Nxb6: White decides to eliminate the DSB and weaken the pawns.
A key provoking move, Black's missing DSB would have been useful here.
moves.16... h6 17. Bh4 g5: ?? While Black would like to drive off the pin, this leaves the kingside too weak.
moves.18. Nxg5: ! Black is now exposed to a withering attack. Of course, taking the N loses the pinned Nf6.
moves.19. Bd3: Safest to decline the pawn and go for the King.
moves.19... Qb6+ 20. Kh2: ?! Imprecise. Better to keep the K off the dark squares to avoid checks.
moves.20... hxg5 21. Rxf6: ! The point. Black can't take the Bishop due to the mate threat.
moves.21... Qe3: ! Nice try, exploiting White's King being on the dark squares.
moves.22. Rf3: If the K had been on h1, Qh5 would have been finito, but Black can check on e5.
moves.22... Qe7 23. Bxg5: The bishop is immune due to the pin.
moves.23... f6 24. Bh6 Rf7 25. Rg3+ Kh8 26. Qh: Now Qh5 is crushing, Black resigns.
